literals:
"

Welcome to the FreeIMU library calibration routine!
Copyright Â© Fabio Varesano 2012.
Released under GPL v3 - See http://www.gnu.org/copyleft/gpl.html

"

"Please load the FreeIMU_serial program from the FreeIMU library examples on your Arduino. Once you correctly installed the FreeIMU library, the examples are available from File->Examples->FreeIMU in the Arduino IDE.\nWhen done, close the Arduino IDE and its serial monitor."
'Insert the serial port which connects to the Arduino (See in the Arduino IDE Tools->Serial Port if in doubt): '

"
The program will now start to sample accelerometer and magnetometers readings. You have to rotate the device in 3D so that your rotations define a complete sphere.
Please try to be as gentle as possible otherwise you may be confuse your accelerometer
"
"Sampling from accelerometer and magnetometer and logging to %s and %s.\nHit CTRL+C to interrupt."
"%d readings logged. Hit CTRL+C to interrupt."
"Calibration procedure completed. The calibration values have been saved to calibration.h and will be compiled in the next compilations of your FreeIMU library code."
comments: we have a command line argument with the serial port
instantiate a serial port object. port gets opened by default, no need to explicitly open it.
we rely on the unhandled serial exception which will stop the program in case of problems during serial opening
